required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SATIN The Acute Effect of Orange Nectar With NAXUS Fibre Made by Novel Processing on Satiety and Satiation
clinical_study.official_title: SATIN The Acute Effect of Orange Nectar With NAXUS Fibre Made by Novel Processing on Satiety and Satiation

brief_summary.textblock: A 4 week double blinded parallel design with an intervention condition and a control condition will be employed. After having completed screening procedure and a baseline test day, participants will be randomized to either intervention or control condition. In the following 4 weeks, the participants will have to consume the distributed food product daily before completing another test day.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.description: Perceptions of hunger, fullness, desire to eat, prospective consumption will be assessed using 100 mm VAS scales

other_outcome.description: Eating behaviour will be assessed by the binge eating scale from Gormally et al. 1982, the Control og Eating questionnaire by Hill et al. 1991, the Power og food scale by Lowe et al 2009, and the Three Factor Eating Questionnaire by Stunkard and Messick, 1985

facility.name: Department of Nutrition Exercise and Sports

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Anders Mikael Sjödin, MD, PHD ass professor
